content.webTitle: The G2 weekly recipe: Almond, lemon and coriander stuffing

fields.headline: The G2 weekly recipe: Almond, lemon and coriander stuffing
fields.bodyText: Sometimes getting through a plate of 18 similar tasting things can make Christmas lunch hard work. In a twist on the standard bready base, this recipe uses brioche as a nod to French Moroccan cuisine. And I've replaced conventional pork with chicken livers for a slightly different feel. You could also ditch the livers for a yummy veggie version. Moorish in so many ways. Makes enough for a chicken - double it for a turkey and treble for a goose - any over gets cooked in a greased baking tray 300g brioche, torn up 250g shallots, finely chopped 1 small preserved lemon, finely chopped or juice and zest of 1 lemon (definitely worth trying to get the preserved ones) 50g toasted, flaked almonds 60g toasted pistachios ½tsp dried chilli flakes 1tsp cumin seed, toasted 40g fresh coriander, washed and chopped 4tbsp extra-virgin olive oil 150g chicken livers, prepped and very roughly chopped (optional) Combine ingredients in a large bowl. Season well. Tastes even better if left to mingle for a few hours before stuffing the bird. · Allegra McEvedy is co-founder of the fast-food chain Leon.
